page.title: 08Land Reclamation Round Wigan
page.content:
Bryn Marsh is a flash we call Weedies. The lakes and ponds were made by sunken land where coal mines had been. There were old railways and derelict land. Now there is grass that used to be slag heaps which makes wildlife more inter- esting. When we went, we saw Canada geese. They were brown, black and white. There are crops in the fields now. The farmer gave us a piece of barley. They planted trees that are beginning to grow. They are about one metre high. In 20 to 100 years nature will take over. Birds will build their nests, squirrels will come, fish will be in the lakes, little creatures will come and wild flowers will grow. So there will be a forest in time.
Lee Pilkington, Lisa J.Carney and Stephen Gaskell - St. Jude's School.
